subject: RE: [junit] help please
msgSnippet: Personally, I don t think it s a good idea to re-invent the wheel , but of course you are doing this for the learning experience, which is excuseable. What
messageBody:
Personally, I don't think it's a good idea to "re-invent the wheel", but
of course you are doing this for the learning experience, which is
excuseable.

What you'll need for your project:

OO design skills
Java programming ability
knowledge of unit testing techniques
knowledge of code coverage techniques
some Java development tools (Eclipse and ant, for instance)
a good book on JUnit
source code to JUnit and a code coverage tool (such as EMMA)

You will hopefully not need direct involvement from ALLAH. If Kent Beck
and Erich Gamma wrote JUnit on an airplane flight, I think you and your
four fellow students can imitate it in time for graduation, without
divine intervention.


Todd.


> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> testing tool will be like JUnit testing tool.
> please any one can help me in this topic send me is this a
> good idea to be implemented?
> what knowledge(tools or technology)should we learn to carry
> out this project?
> what are the problems to implement this project?
> Note:we are 5 members and work with JAVA.
> please reply me soon and also send your comments about any
> questions that I have not asked.
>
>
>
